result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Shauna M. Sarkauskas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shauna M. Sarkauskas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shauna M. Sarkauskas was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Shauna M. Sarkauskas not in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:21
Defendant has complied- moves to dismiss- Granted
DEJ

11:52 a.m. Defendant Shauna M. Sarkauskas in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 15cf281 and 16cv18. Schiek states agreement. State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 3 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1 and 4. Plea questionnaire and Deferred Entry of Judgment filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, accepts plea, defers entry of judgment and accepts written DEJ filed. Schiek/Cirilli/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence - Count 1
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Bail continued.
Special disposition under 973.015 if defendant successfully completes probation and pays all fines/costs/fees. 

In 16cv18 - Schiek moves for forfeiture judgment - granted. DA's office will prepare order for Court's signature.
